intro: Helianthella argophylla, commonly known as the silverleaf helianthella, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It is characterized by its silver-gray foliage, which is covered in fine, fuzzy hairs. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the spring and summer. It typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in mountainous regions. Helianthella argophylla is a member of the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is adapted to arid environments.
